title: Darren Treacy (rugby league)
text:
Darren Treacy (born 26 June 1971) is an Australian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1990s and 2000s. He played for the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a>, <a href="St.%20George%20Dragons">St. George Dragons</a>, <a href="St.%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St. George Illawarra Dragons</a> and the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a>.
Playing career.
Treacy made his first grade debut for Newcastle against South Sydney in Round 1 1994. In 1995, Treacy played in the club's finals series as they reached the preliminary final before being defeated by Manly-Warringah.
In 1997, Treacy joined St George and in 1998 played in the club's final ever game as a stand-alone entity which was a 20–12 loss to Canterbury in the 1998 finals series.
In 1999, St George announced a joint venture with Illawarra to form St George Illawarra. Treacy played in the club inaugural game against Parramatta. Treacy then played for the club at second-row forward in their <a href="1999%20NRL%20Grand%20Final">1999 NRL Grand Final</a> loss to the <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a>. Treacy then had a spell in England with the <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford City Reds</a> in 2002.
In 2003, Treacy returned to Australia and played 1 season with Parramatta before retiring at the end of the season.
